content: The four-century-old festival is celebrated during Sankranthi, displaying a chariot procession taken out by 11 villages

title: Mamata will not get Matua votes, Suvendu claims after TMC rally
content: The BJP MLA also wrote to Chief Election Commissioner accusing State police officials of being affiliated to TMC and demanding the deployment of CAPF ‚Äúto ensure neutrality‚Äù in upcoming Assembly polls in 2026

title: Congress, NCP (SP) write to SEC over voter rolls, seeking transparency ahead of local body polls
content: Congress seeks 15-day extension for objections to draft voter lists as NCP (SP) flags coercion in local polls, a day after Uddhav and Raj Thackeray demanded¬†21 days

title: Raksha Khadse accuses Shinde-led Shiv Sena workers of intimidation in¬†Muktainagar
content: Raksha Khadse accused workers of Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena of intimidating residents in¬†Muktainagar, citing rising crime and harassment

title: Man acquitted in 26/11 case free to take up jobs that don‚Äôt need police clearance: Maharashtra Government
content: In September 2025, the Maharashtra government refused to issue a police clearance certificate to Fahim Ansari, acquitted in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks case, saying he¬†remains¬†under surveillance over suspected links to a banned terror outfit

title: Tribal teacher ushers in change, revives dilapidated school in ASR district
content: Palasa Naveen Kumar raises funds, involves community leaders to renovate the dilapidated building and guides 17 students to qualify Navodaya and Ekalavya entrance exams

title: Cabinet clears Rs 7,200 cr rare earths scheme - why it‚Äôs important
content: India is set to significantly bolster its rare earth magnet production with the Union Cabinet approving a Rs 7,280 crore scheme. This pioneering initiative aims to establish integrated manufacturing facilities, boosting domestic capacity to 6,000 metric tons annually. The seven-year plan focuses on the entire value chain, from oxides to finished magnets, enhancing India's strategic self-reliance.

title: K'taka CM row: Sidda wants high command to decide soon; min confirms push citing DKS' ambition
content: Karnataka minister Satish Jarkiholi revealed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has urged the Congress high command for a swift decision on leadership change. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has consistently expressed his ambition for the chief minister's role. Jarkiholi plans to discuss the matter with Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge.

title: Where is Imran Khan? Rumours over ex-Pak PM take over social media; sisters assaulted
content: Speculation surrounds Imran Khan's fate after his sisters were allegedly assaulted by police while seeking a meeting. Social media claims he was killed in Adiala Jail, where he has been held since August 2023. His sisters reported a "brutal and orchestrated assault" by Punjab police during a peaceful protest outside the jail.

title: Why coach Gambhir, chief selector Agarkar are answerable for home debacles
content: Indian cricket faces a crisis after recent home Test series losses. Coach Gautam Gambhir is under pressure amid team's poor performance. Questions arise about planning and player selection. The team's fortress has collapsed, leading to a need for strategic changes. This situation demands attention and a clear path forward for Indian cricket.

title: How to flatter Trump 101: US envoy gave lesson to Russia on peace deal; call exposes coaching
content: A US envoy reportedly advised Russia's top foreign policy adviser on how President Putin should pitch a peace plan to then-President Trump. The plan, discussed with Trump's team, aimed to leverage Trump's perceived role as a "man of peace" following a Gaza deal. The White House described the approach as "standard negotiating procedure."

title: Report error: Deloitte makes ‚ÄòAI mistake‚Äô again; here‚Äôs what went wrong
content: Deloitte faces scrutiny again after an AI-generated report for the Canadian government contained significant factual errors regarding healthcare services. This follows a similar incident last month where the firm refunded Australia $290,000 for an AI-tainted report. These repeated missteps raise serious concerns about AI oversight in critical government work and erode public trust.

title: Deepti Chaurasia, daughter-in-law of prominent pan masala group owner, dies by suicide in Delhi
content: A 40-year-old woman, identified as Deepti Chaurasia, daughter-in-law of a pan masala group owner, allegedly died by suicide in Vasant Vihar, south Delhi. Police have recovered a suicide note and are conducting an inquest into the matter. Family members have been interviewed, and an autopsy has been performed.

title: Delhi Capitals co-owner pushes for 'specialist red ball coach' after series loss
content: India men's cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir stated that the BCCI will decide his future following the 2-0 Test series whitewash against South Africa. Gambhir acknowledged the team's recent performance but also highlighted previous successes, including results in England, the Champions Trophy, and the Asia Cup.

title: Massive fire engulfs multiple high rises in Hong Kong; at least 4 dead - video
content: A devastating fire ripped through multiple high-rise towers at Wang Fuk Court in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, claiming at least four lives and trapping several others. Firefighters battled thick smoke billowing from the 31-storey residential blocks, which house approximately 2,000 apartments, as two residents remained in critical condition with burn injuries.

title: Nvidia publicly responds to 'losing' $250 billion to 'Google deal,' declares: We are‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia, the AI chip giant, publicly defended its market dominance after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering billions in spending on Google's competing AI chips. This news sent Nvidia's stock down significantly, while Alphabet shares rose. Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a serious challenger, with Meta potentially renting them from Google Cloud.

title: Harmer hammer for India: SA spinner surpasses Dale Steyn; breaks multiple records
content: South Africa achieved a historic Test series triumph in India, winning the second Test by a massive 408 runs. This marked India's largest-ever defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win on Indian soil in 25 years. Off-spinner Simon Harmer was instrumental, taking 17 wickets and becoming South Africa's leading wicket-taker in India.

title: ‚ÄòIn spur of the moment‚Äô: Ex-CJI Gavai reacts to no action after shoe hurling bid
content: Former Chief Justice of India, B.R. Gavai, revealed he acted on instinct during a shoe-hurling attempt in the Supreme Court, choosing to continue hearings immediately.  Despite the incident, he advised the Bar not to be distracted.  The accused lawyer's outburst was reportedly linked to alleged remarks by Gavai, which the former CJI has denied.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: Mosques take mic: In UP, imams lead the charge to help Muslims navigate SIR confusion
content: Across Muslim-majority neighbourhoods, this new civic refrain has become familiar. Officials say it is a routine update ahead of the 2027 assembly elections. But in neighbourhoods bruised by anxieties around CAA and NRC, the exercise is filled with anxiety.

title: US‚ÄìChina trade thaw? Beijing buys $300 million in US soybeans after Trump‚ÄìXi phone call
content: China has purchased at least 10 cargoes of US soybeans, valued at approximately $300 million, following a call between Presidents Trump and Xi. These deals signal a potential thaw in trade relations, with shipments scheduled for January. Despite higher prices than Brazilian alternatives, state-run COFCO has been a significant buyer, with broader purchase agreements in place.

title: Elle Duncan: ESPN star eyes Netflix leap to lead its sports lineup
content: Netflix is reportedly set to hire ESPN host Elle Duncan as its first full-time sportscaster, aiming to bolster its expanding sports division. While a contract isn't finalized, the move could see Duncan become the new face of Netflix's sports content, potentially allowing her to continue some ESPN appearances. This development follows Netflix's increased investment in live sports broadcasting.

title: 'Up to BCCI to decide my future': Gambhir faces heat after 2-0 whitewash; highlights past successes
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir accepted blame for India's Test series defeat, acknowledging the team's collapse against South Africa. While admitting collective failure, he highlighted past successes and stated his future rests with the BCCI. Gambhir defended his selection strategy, emphasising tough characters over flair for Test cricket.

title: Cabinet clears two major rail multitracking projects in Maharashtra & Gujarat - details
content: The Indian government has approved two major railway projects totaling Rs 2,781 crore, adding 224 km of track in Maharashtra and Gujarat. These initiatives aim to boost connectivity, ease congestion, and support economic growth, aligning with the PM Gati Shakti vision. The projects will enhance mobility for millions and significantly improve freight movement, contributing to climate goals.

title: Silent plastic chemicals may be harming hearts and putting millions at risk
content: A major global study warns that everyday plastics, containing phthalates, pose hidden dangers to heart health. These chemicals, found in common household items, are linked to over a lakh heart-related deaths in India annually. Reducing plastic use and choosing safer alternatives can significantly lower exposure and protect against long-term cardiovascular risks.

title: ‚ÄòSerious security breach‚Äô: EC writes to Kolkata Police; seeks 48-hour action report
content: The Election Commission of India has expressed serious concern over the safety of poll officials in West Bengal following a security breach at the Chief Electoral Officer's office. The ECI has directed Kolkata Police to ensure immediate safety measures for officials at their offices, residences, and during travel, citing the sensitivity of upcoming elections.

title: Delhi again found most polluted; study finds persistently high PM2.5 levels across India
content: Delhi emerges as India's most polluted region, with PM2.5 levels a staggering 20 times the WHO guideline. A new satellite study reveals the Indo-Gangetic airshed remains critically polluted, while the Northeast, particularly Assam-Tripura, is a growing concern.  This year-round crisis demands a shift from city-centric to airshed-based pollution management.

title: Tata Sierra 2025 launched at Rs 11.49 lakh with bold SUV design & luxury interiors
content: The TATA Sierra has returned with a striking makeover, blending luxury, technology, and performance for the premium SUV market. Priced from Rs 11.49 Lakh, it aims to offer an aspirational yet attainable driving experience.  With its "Escape Mediocre" ethos, the Sierra transforms every journey into an extraordinary adventure through comfort, advanced features, and robust performance.

title: Russian oil trade: Discounts soften impact of losing sanctioned barrels
content: US sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil are impacting Indian refiners less than anticipated, as wider discounts on Russian crude offset expected volume drops. Refiners are sourcing from non-sanctioned suppliers, with increased discounts nearly compensating for reduced Russian cargo intake. This shift, coupled with a well-supplied global market, keeps procurement costs stable.

title: Bihar DElEd result 2025 released: Check direct link to download scorecards here
content: Bihar School Examination Board has released the DElEd Joint Entrance Examination 2025 results. Over 2.5 lakh candidates have passed the exam. The pass percentage stands at 79.01%. Admissions to DElEd institutions will commence soon through an online counselling system. The application window opens on November 29 and closes on December 5, 2025.

title: Gentildonna passes away at 16: Tributes pour in for Japan Cup 2012 champion
content: Japanese racing legend Gentildonna, the real horse behind the popular Umamusume character, has passed away at 16. Celebrated for her seven G1 victories, including two Japan Cups and the Triple Tiara, she captivated fans and inspired a generation. Her peaceful passing at Northern Farm marks the end of an illustrious career, leaving a lasting legacy in both racing and gaming.

title: Meerut blue drum murder: Accused Muskan names newborn 'Radha'; in-laws demand DNA test
content: Accused of murdering her husband and concealing his body, Muskan named her newborn daughter Radha. Her in-laws are demanding a DNA test to confirm the baby's parentage, stating they will only accept the child if proven to be Saurabh Rajput's biological daughter. The baby was born on what would have been Saurabh's birthday.

title: Home whitewash: 'Test cricket can't survive on chaos' - Kumble slams Team India
content: India's recent Test series defeat to South Africa has sparked widespread criticism from former cricketers like Anil Kumble and Venkatesh Prasad. They are calling for an urgent overhaul of the team's strategy, citing issues like excessive all-rounder selection and constant team changes. This marks a significant decline in India's home Test performance.

title: New low! India fall below Pakistan in WTC table after 0-2 whitewash against South Africa
content: South Africa completed a historic tour, recording only their second Test series victory in India ‚Äî and their first since the iconic 2000 triumph under Hansie Cronje. The result also marked India‚Äôs biggest defeat by runs in Test cricket, adding further weight to an already bruising outcome. The impact was immediate in the WTC table.

title: 'Will be pleasantly surprised by the actions of Xi': Trump confirms China visit in April
content: President Donald Trump announced plans to visit Beijing in April, citing a strong personal rapport with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping. The leaders discussed trade, Ukraine, and fentanyl during a recent phone call, aiming to maintain positive momentum. Trump also highlighted strong US-Japan ties during recent diplomatic outreach.

title: Watch: Israeli teenager hangs on crane for 8 hours; claims he climbed to 'see the view'
content: In a gripping event in Jerusalem, emergency crews executed a remarkable rescue of a 15-year-old boy who found himself perilously suspended 300 meters high on a crane. Climbing up for an adventurous view, the teenager hung there for several hours before firefighters launched a sophisticated operation to bring him back to safety.

title: Pune airport chaos: Pilot refuses to fly plane to Delhi; cites duty-time cap
content: Over 100 Delhi-bound flyers faced a three-hour delay at Pune airport Tuesday morning after an IndiGo captain refused to fly due to flight duty time limitations. An Amritsar-bound IndiGo flight also experienced a similar delay for the same reason. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of prior information and airline planning.

title: 'Need real oxygen of friends and family': Sweden NRI says loneliness abroad worse than AQI back home
content: An Indian man, Ankur Tyagi, is returning to Delhi from Sweden, finding life there emotionally easier despite Europe's clean air and systems. He misses the strong community and human contact, stating that while India has chaos, it also offers support. Tyagi acknowledges Delhi's pollution but prioritizes the 'oxygen' of friends and family, a sentiment echoed by others considering similar moves.

title: $9.12 million Superman comic: Three brothers discover first edition in family attic
content: A rare first-edition 1939 Superman comic book, discovered in a family attic, has shattered records by selling for over $9 million. This unrestored, high-grade copy, found by three brothers while clearing out their late mother's belongings, is now the most expensive comic ever sold, highlighting its cultural significance and pristine condition.

title: Near record highs again: Why Nifty-Sensex created Rs 4 lakh crore wealth in a day
content: Indian stock markets are nearing record highs. A significant surge in investor wealth occurred on Wednesday. This rally is fueled by hopes of interest rate cuts in India and abroad. Global market optimism and declining crude oil prices are also contributing factors. Foreign investors are returning as buyers. Corporate earnings are showing signs of recovery, leading to broad market participation.

title: 'Not clicked at comedy club': Kunal Kamra wears T-shirt mocking RSS; BJP warns of police action
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra has sparked controversy with a social media post featuring a T-shirt seemingly mocking the RSS. The BJP has reacted strongly, with leaders warning of police action against such objectionable content. This incident follows Kamra's previous clashes with political figures, including Prime Minister Modi and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

title: Delhi blast: NIA takes Muzammil to Al-Falah campus rooms where ammonium nitrate was kept
content: NIA recreated the Delhi blast crime scene with arrested Al-Falah University doctor Muzammil Ahmad Ganaie. He was taken to rented rooms where explosives were stored and to his university accommodation, believed to be the plot's nerve center. Investigators are probing the doctors' alleged links to handlers in Pakistan and Turkey.

title: South Africa create history: First Test series win in India in 25 years
content: South Africa registered a massive 408-run victory over India in the second Test, securing a 2-0 series sweep. Spinner Simon Harmer's exceptional 6-wicket haul dismantled India's batting for 140, marking India's heaviest Test defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win in India in 25 years. Marco Jansen was named player of the match for his all-round performance.

title: ‚ÄòCity I lived in for 13 years doesn‚Äôt want me‚Äô: Kashmiri Muslim tenants face bias in Delhi
content: Kashmiri Muslims in Delhi face severe housing discrimination following a recent terror attack. Professionals like Maria Bilal and Omar Peerzada report being denied rentals solely based on their religion, despite strong credentials. This trend, acknowledged by brokers and even the J&K Chief Minister, highlights a growing alienation for the community.

title: Free agent pickups: The players you need for a playoff push
content: the 12th Sunday of the season featured a historic outing by a Detroit Lions RB Jahmyr Gibbs and a notable comeback victories by the desperate Kansas City Chiefs and Dallas Cowboys . four teams served their bye this week, but none do this coming Thanksgiving week, which features a trio of games on Thursday .

title: Sources: CSU expected to hire UConn's Mora
content: the deal is expected to come together in the near future, sources say . he will come to Colorado State as the school is joining the Pac-12 . it has churned through Mike Bobo, Steve Addazio and Jay Norvell .

title: Who's ready for Thanksgiving Day football? Picks, predictions and X factors
content: the average over/under point total of 51.2 is the highest for Thanksgiving games over the past 40 seasons . ESPN Research provides optimistic stats for all six teams, along with betting nuggets to know . three analysts give us final score picks for the three games .

title: Bills add help at receiver, sign veteran Cooks
content: the bills have elevated receiver Gabe Davis from the practice squad for the past two games . second-year receiver Keon Coleman has been a healthy scratch for the last two games stemming initially from disciplinary issues . quarterback dalton Kincaid has the most receiving touchdowns on the team wi-fi .

title: The wolves of Real Madrid are already snarling at Xabi Alonso's door
content: Xabi Alonso has defended his side following their 2-2 draw against Elche . the real madrid boss is in the top eight positions of the UEFA champions league . but he'll know he is. wolves are at the door and someone at his club is encouraging them to snarl .

title: Bottom 10: The Lane Train seems to have gone off track
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: MLB offseason grades: Boston bolsters rotation with swap for Sonny Gray
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here . we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . a big-money free agent signing changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: Grades for all 32 NHL teams a quarter way through the season
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .
